result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pedro Velazquez Jr

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on February 13, 2023 at 10:00 am.

11:37 AM This case is being called for a hearing. Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Pedro Velazquez Jr. Defendant Pedro Velazquez Jr in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Attorney Menden advises that the defendant is in programming and requesting a date in February for a projected plea/sentencing. Court will adjourn for plea/sentencing in February.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:51 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Pedro Velazquez Jr in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Pedro Velazquez Jr.  Atty. Menden provides an update, she needs additional time to look into the case and is asking the court not issue the capias which was stayed until today's hearing. Court will quash the capias.   No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:22 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Pedro Velazquez did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Menden advises she was in contact with her client this morning and was advised by her client he could not make it to court due to transporation issues.  State would not object to the Court staying a capias to another court date.  Court inquires when the defendant will be done with treatment.  Atty. Menden advises it will still be a little longer due to some issues.  Court will authorize but stay the issuance of a capias.  Court will adjourn for status in about 45 days.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:01 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Pedro Velazquez in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Menden advises she just received the offer today and which requires some upfront treatment, as a result she is requesting a further proceedings date in about 60 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Eryn Menden appointed counsel by Public Defender's Office
Hearing on May 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A/witnesses A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:22 PM Defendant Pedro Velazquez in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
